intro: Freziera oxapampensis, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Freziera oxapampensis is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in gardens that mimic its natural habitat.
